1.title: Episode #9.1
1.plot: In Gateshead a man threatens a woman with a crossbow and a siege unfolds on a busy residential street. A crackdown is launched on cannabis farms. PCSO's Craig and Jill discover a family under attack.

2.title: Episode #9.2
2.plot: A woman in Newcastle threatens to harm herself, when police track her down they find she is on a bridge. A prisoner on the run is apprehended in Sunderland. A youngster is injured at a derelict school.

3.title: Episode #9.3
3.plot: Cooky and Sarah try to bring peace to an area of Sunderland plagued by two sets of nightmare neighbours. In the rural market town of Hexham, Barry and Auriol must find a homeless man whose erratic behaviour is causing alarm.

4.title: Episode #9.4
4.plot: Northumbria Police launch Operation Flynn aimed at getting wanted criminals who have fled justice behind bars. A vicious attack on a bus sparks a hunt for a wayward teenager.

5.title: Episode #9.5
5.plot: In Sunderland officers track down a couple who have been caught on camera using a credit card stolen in a burglary. Marine officers bring to book those breaking the rules of the water.

6.title: Episode #9.6
6.plot: In Sunderland officers raid a house they believe to be connected to drug use. PCSOs Jill and Craig investigate an unusual hate crime - someone has written racist graffiti on grass in the park opposite a mosque with a lawnmower.

7.title: Episode #9.7
7.plot: In Gateshead, a man is attacked outside a busy row of shops but doesn't want to report it or be treated by paramedics. Officers are on duty at the annual Sunderland International Airshow.

8.title: Episode #9.8
8.plot: Officers in Sunderland target shoplifters by sharing intelligence with shopkeepers to target the worst offenders. In Newcastle police deal with a road collision. A man is arrested for theft from a pharmacy in Gateshead.

9.title: Episode #9.9
9.plot: The Gateshead team join forces with the Home Office to investigate reports of illegal immigrants working in the area. In Sunderland a cannabis farm is investigated. Officers attend Remembrance Sunday services.

10.title: Episode #9.10
10.plot: A man arrested for violent behaviour in Washington gives cause for concern in custody. Officers in Blyth attend a seafront festival. There is shock in Sunderland due to reports of a man wearing only cowboy boots in the high street.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: The police crack down on public drinking and set up a sting operation aimed at stolen goods. They also attend a community surgery, listening to local concerns and offer support to victims of a race hate crime.

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: In this edition of the documentary series the team answer a cry for help from a landlady and take part in a stake-out operation. They also discover a baby in an unsafe condition.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Officers track down a man who on the run, step up patrols on street corners and increase awareness of purse snatching. They also try to discover who is behind a series of poison pen letters.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Officers raid a suspected drug dealer's den, crack down on anti-social behaviour, are on the lookout for thieves targeting gardens and clamp down on illegal fake designer fashions.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot:
Know what this is about?

9.title: Episode #7.9
9.plot: A vicious, motiveless attack on a young man in Weston-Super-Mare is caught on CCTV. When officers come to the aid of a young man who has had his bag stolen they make an unusual discovery inside it.

10.title: Episode #7.10
10.plot: A strange late-night break-in turns from a manhunt to a search and rescue operation. In Bath, officers are shocked when they investigate a beggar. A drunken pensioner causes trouble in Bridgwater.

1.title: Episode #8.1
1.plot: Racial tensions are high in Sunderland after a brick is thrown through the window of a house with a chilling note attached. A cannabis farm is discovered in Southwick and PCSO's help an old man shaken by burglary.

2.title: Episode #8.2
2.plot: In Blyth, PC Stuart Thomson must take a sensitive approach when dealing with the bullying of a disabled child. PCSOs Mick and Deborah are called to a van which is one fire.

3.title: Episode #8.3
3.plot: In Southwick, the team come to the aid of a man being tormented by anti-social youths and the mother of one of the culprits. A man living in a caravan causes distress to local residents.

4.title: Episode #8.4
4.plot: In Washington, police raid the home of man suspected of growing cannabis in his loft. In Southwick, officers raid the home of a suspected drug dealer. The team give two German tourists a nice surprise.

5.title: Episode #8.5
5.plot: Officers in Sunderland investigate racist graffiti outside a mosque. Louise uses her local knowledge to try and locate a runaway who may be hiding on a busy railway line.

6.title: Episode #8.6
6.plot: The army are called in and homes evacuated after a Gateshead resident discovers a hand grenade placed on her garden wall. PCSO Debbie sees the dark side of living rough in Sunderland city centre.

7.title: Episode #8.7
7.plot: Northumbria Police launch Operation Flynn targeting wanted and active criminals across their patch.

8.title: Episode #8.8
8.plot: The team are called to reports of a woman vandalising a window, ultimately leading to a shocking assault. They also help two young lads who have been stranded.

9.title: Episode #8.9
9.plot: The team race to the scene of a serious car accident in Sunderland, where it becomes apparent that the driver of one of the cars was uninsured and ran from the scene. Officers visit a man who has suffered racial abuse.

10.title: Episode #8.10
10.plot: Officers in Blyth carry out a sting operation to re-capture a repeat offender who has gone on the run. In Sunderland PCs work closely with local business owners to clamp down on shoplifting.

imdb.title: Neighbourhood Blues
plot: Documentary series following the hard work and dedication of pioneering community policing teams as they confront the problems of troubled communities.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
